notes_translated.fr-t-en: L'équivalent pleine charge (FLE) est une mesure utilisée pour que nous puissions faire des calculs comparables entre différentes institutions, entre différents programmes. Le FLE est mesuré en prenant la charge de l'étudiant inscrit (heures d'enseignement + heures de stage) et en divisant par la charge complète de ce programme. Il en résulte une mesure comparable pouvant être utilisée dans l'ensemble du système. Le calcul du FLE est cohérent pour chaque établissement et programme. Le domaine d'études est indiqué à l'aide du code CIP (Classification of Instructional Programs) 2011 attribué à chaque programme et spécialisation. Les codes CIP sont utilisés pour classer les programmes semblables en fonction du contenu pédagogique du programme ou de la spécialité. Cet ensemble de données montrera la mesure FLE par code CIP à 2 chiffres par année académique.
notes_translated.en: Full Load Equivalent (FLE) is a measure used so that we can make comparable calculations across different institutions, across different programs. The FLE is measured by taking the load of the student enrolled (instructional hours + practicum hours) and dividing by the full load of that program. This results in a comparable metric to be able to use across the system. The FLE calculation is consistent for every institution and program. Field of study is reported using the CIP (Classification of Instructional Programs) 2011 code value assigned to each program and specialization. CIP codes are used to classify like programs based on the instructional content of the program/specializations. This dataset will show the FLE measure by each 2 digit CIP code by Academic Year.

The FLE is measured by taking the load of the student enrolled (instructional hours + practicum hours) and dividing by the full load of that program. This results in a comparable metric to be able to use across the system. The FLE calculation is consistent for every institution and program. Field of study is reported using the CIP (Classification of Instructional Programs) 2011 code value assigned to each program and specialization. CIP codes are used to classify like programs based on the instructional content of the program/specializations. This dataset will show the FLE measure by each 2 digit CIP code by Academic Year.
